2020-08-30T14:40:57Z: Norris ends the race in P7, with Gasly, Stroll and Perez rounding out the scorers.
2020-08-30T14:40:34Z: Bottas and Verstappen will flank Hamilton on the podium. Ricciardo and Ocon get fourth and fifth, with Albon having to be content with sixth.
2020-08-30T14:39:14Z: Ricciardo snatches the fastest lap with a 1m47.483s! We've barely seen him all day!
2020-08-30T14:38:34Z: On the final lap, Ocon finally clears Albon and completes a 4-5 for Renault.
2020-08-30T14:38:07Z: And Lewis Hamilton wins the Belgian GP!
2020-08-30T14:37:11Z: Gasly gets up to P8 on the penultimate lap as he overtakes Stroll. It has been a terrific performance by the AlphaTauri driver this afternoon.
2020-08-30T14:35:03Z: Albon holds the line perfectly once more into Les Combes, keeping Ocon at bay for a while longer.
2020-08-30T14:34:10Z: A big battle for fifth is brewing, as Albon, Ocon and Norris are all grouped together.
2020-08-30T14:32:19Z: On lap 40 the alternate strategy duo swap places as Gasly overtakes Perez with the aid of DRS at the end of the Kemmel Straight. Gasly is up to P9 and hunting down Stroll.
2020-08-30T14:31:21Z: Ocon has a go at Albon onto the Kemmel Straight, but Albon gets his lines right and defends from the Renault driver.
2020-08-30T14:30:08Z: The leaders are hanging onto their tyres now, being told to be super-careful in the last few laps. Bottas was told to stay off the kerbs after a Bus Stop lock-up.
2020-08-30T14:29:23Z: Norris is up to P7 after getting ahead of Stroll and is closing in on Ocon. The lone McLaren has six laps to catch the Renault ahead of him.
2020-08-30T14:28:17Z: Ocon's homing in on Albon, so he'll presumably secure P5 before the race is out.
2020-08-30T14:27:16Z: As we poke fun at the tyre graphic, Hamilton had a lock-up into the Bus Stop and lost a second to Bottas. I'm preparing to tuck into humble pie.
2020-08-30T14:26:39Z: Perez and Gasly are on a crusade through the midfield using the alternate strategy. The Racing Point driver goes around the outside of Kvyat at Les Combes to take P9, with Gasly following him through later in the lap, but the Russian driver made it easier work for his team-mate to get ahead.
2020-08-30T14:24:47Z: Hamilton has 10% of his front tyre left, according the the INFAMOUS tyre performance graphic. Which probably means he could do another race distance on them...
2020-08-30T14:23:19Z: An overtake by a Ferrari driver to report (you read that right), as Leclerc gets ahead of Magnussen for P15 on the Kemmel Straight on lap 35. Small comfort on a tough afternoon for Ferrari.
2020-08-30T14:22:13Z: Verstappen, meanwhile, is suffering with some vibrations in his tyres. Nobody's having much fun out there, it seems.
2020-08-30T14:21:45Z: The very next lap Gasly gets by Raikkonen to take P11 with the same move Perez pulled off. Raikkonen, just like Vettel did, locks up at the end of the straight as soon as Gasly gets by.
2020-08-30T14:20:48Z: Ocon's within 3s of Albon now, so it's certainly looking as though the medium compound is not the one to be on. Good Red Bull tyre strategy calls seem to be limited to one driver.
2020-08-30T14:19:32Z: Perez produces a carbon copy of Gasly's earlier overtake on Vettel as the Racing Point driver powers past Raikkonen on the Kemmel Straight to take 10th place.
2020-08-30T14:17:43Z: ...and the power of the AlphaTauri Honda eases ahead of the Ferrari at the end of the Kemmel Straight to see Gasly take P12 on lap 32.
2020-08-30T14:16:38Z: Albon's now dropping a bit, perhaps having come to an impasse with his medium tyres. He's now 5s behind Ricciardo, with Ocon slowly closing in.
2020-08-30T14:16:07Z: Gasly has made light work of getting ahead of Magnussen and Grosjean and now has Vettel in his sights...
2020-08-30T14:13:11Z: Hamilton's advantage to Bottas is now up to 4.4s, with Verstappen a further 3.3s behind the second Mercedes driver.
2020-08-30T14:12:38Z: Vettel, who offers a spicy exchange about Ferrari's race strategy, is powerless to stop Perez from passing him at the end of the Kemmel Straight to see the Racing Point move up to P11 on lap 29.
2020-08-30T14:09:45Z: Perez is already up to P12 following the stops by Leclerc and Gasly, having got ahead of both Haas drivers, and is now hunting down Vettel.
2020-08-30T14:09:34Z: Hamilton, meanwhile, has pinged in a 1m47.758s lap to further extend his now-3.8s advantage over Bottas.
2020-08-30T14:07:54Z: Gasly pitted at the end of lap 26, dropping to P16.
2020-08-30T14:06:17Z: Gasly doesn't defend from Ocon too much, taking to the inside line as his compatriot passes on the Kemmel Straight.
2020-08-30T14:04:21Z: That fan screen along the Kemmel Straight is a bit...awkward isn't it?
2020-08-30T14:03:36Z: Hamilton logs a 1m48.123s to put in another fastest lap. Bottas is told the track temp will drop with the greater cloud cover.
2020-08-30T14:02:59Z: Perez, the last driver to pit in this race, has an almighty task ahead to carve his way into the points places. The Racing Point driver has just moved out of last place by overtaking Latifi and is now hunting down the Haas duo.
2020-08-30T14:02:34Z: And Albon has enough on Gasly at the start of lap 24 to get the move done - a deficit of 0.5-0.6s across the start-finish line seems to be enough to get the run with DRS.
2020-08-30T14:00:30Z: Albon is probing Gasly, but the AlphaTauri seems to be much stronger out of the corners than the Red Bull at this point.
2020-08-30T13:56:51Z: And that's a slam-dunk move for Ricciardo, charging past Gasly on the Kemmel Straight with DRS. P4 is the Australian's reward.
2020-08-30T13:55:55Z: How do you make the afternoon any worse for Ferrari? By having their drivers clash on track fighting for P12. Leclerc and Vettel come very close to repeating their Styrian GP collision as Leclerc has a look around the outside of his team-mate at Les Combes and the pair bash wheels but get away without picking up damage. Vettel keeps P12.
2020-08-30T13:53:12Z: Ricciardo is now winding in Gasly, with Albon also getting back onto Ricciardo's tail.
2020-08-30T13:52:01Z: Perez pits at the end of lap 18 from P7 to get rid of his soft tyres and take a fresh set of hards.
2020-08-30T13:50:06Z: Albon doubles the frustration for Perez as he gets ahead to take P6 at the Bus Stop chicane at the end of lap 17.
2020-08-30T13:49:24Z: Ricciardo steams past Perez on the Kemmel Straight, grabbing P5 from the yet-to-pit Racing Point driver.
2020-08-30T13:48:38Z: Bottas did a 1m48.156s on that last tour, but Hamilton's going a bit quicker this time around.
2020-08-30T13:48:32Z: Raikkonen is one that pulls off an overtake as he gets ahead of former team-mate Vettel to take P12 at the end of the Kemmel Straight on lap 16. That puts the Alfa Romeo driver ahead of both Ferrari drivers, which isn't something that happens too often.
2020-08-30T13:48:10Z: Hamilton is told that the power drops are just energy management related, so he seems to be a-okay. Bottas is closing, though...
2020-08-30T13:46:54Z: Albon on the faster medium tyres pressures Ricciardo but isn't able to carve out an overtake on the opening lap of the restart. That keeps the Red Bull driver in P7.
2020-08-30T13:46:18Z: Hamilton does a 1m48.325s to really put the hammer down.
2020-08-30T13:45:16Z: Perez gets a run at Gasly, but can't find a way though at the Kemmel Straight.
2020-08-30T13:44:30Z: We're back up and running - and Hamilton guns it down Blanchimont to get the advantage.
2020-08-30T13:42:49Z: One of the other lucky drivers in that incident was Raikkonen who had team-mate Giovinazzi crashing directly in front of him but he was able to get by before he rebounded on to the track and duly collect Russell.
2020-08-30T13:42:48Z: Safety car will come in at the end of lap 14, ie. this lap.
2020-08-30T13:42:11Z: Albon's on the mediums, so Red Bull trying something a little bit different with his tyres compared to the hard runners.
2020-08-30T13:39:07Z: TV replays show Giovinazzi losing control of his Alfa Romeo at Les Fagnes and he hits the outside wall and rebounds back towards the track. That gives poor Russell no option but to take avoiding action as he hits one of Giovinazzi's wheels that came off in the clash, which puts the Williams driver into the inside tyre wall. Thankfully, both drivers are walking away from the clash and appear to be OK.
2020-08-30T13:36:42Z: Albon jumps Ocon in the stops, as Renault had less time to double-stack.
2020-08-30T13:36:07Z: The Mercedes drivers pit for fresh tyres, as do the Red Bulls and Renaults.
2020-08-30T13:35:35Z: The leaders gingerly make their way through the debris at Les Fagnes - a lot of carbon fibre left on the circuit.
2020-08-30T13:33:54Z: That clash has called out the Safety Car on lap 11.
2020-08-30T13:33:21Z: Oh no! Giovinazzi and Russell have come together in a huge crash! Both drivers appear to be OK and getting out of their cars.
2020-08-30T13:31:16Z: Some sympathy must be given to Leclerc as his excellent start has been undone by his slow Ferrari on the straights. From P13 to P8 and back to P12 across the opening phase of this race.
2020-08-30T13:31:10Z: Ricciardo has fallen behind Verstappen by almost 7s now, while Albon is still keeping tabs on Ocon for the time being.
2020-08-30T13:28:47Z: A lap later Leclerc suffers a sense of deja vu as Kvyat becomes the latest driver to simple power ahead of him on the Kemmel Straight. The aid of DRS is one thing, but the power deficit Ferrari has against its rivals is staggering.
2020-08-30T13:27:50Z: Hamilton and Bottas set virtually identical times on lap 7, as they waltz away from the rest of the field.
2020-08-30T13:26:34Z: Norris breezes by Leclerc to take 10th place on the Kemmel Straight on lap six.
2020-08-30T13:25:32Z: Gasly, on the hard tyres, will be the one to watch in the midfield as this race develops with the AlphaTauri driver on the alternative strategy to everyone around him who are currently on the soft tyres.
2020-08-30T13:24:18Z: Hamilton now smashes in a 1m49.470s to open the gap up to Bottas considerably. A statement of intent there.
2020-08-30T13:23:18Z: Perez, now ahead of Leclerc in ninth place, has settled into a stronger rhythm after his poor start and is chasing after the fast-starting Gasly.
2020-08-30T13:22:40Z: Another fastest lap for Bottas - the first man in the 1m49s with a 1m49.937s. The gap's at just over a second between him and race leader Hamilton.
2020-08-30T13:21:08Z: Albon's coming back at Ocon now, he had a run with DRS but couldn't dispatch the Renault driver.
2020-08-30T13:20:43Z: Ricciardo and Verstappen squabbling over room on that opening lap, both finding the limits of the track through Les Combes and Malmedy.
2020-08-30T13:20:02Z: The power of the AlphaTauri Honda (with the aid of DRS) allows Gasly to blast ahead of Leclerc down the Kemmel Straight on the third lap. That moves Gasly up to eighth place.
2020-08-30T13:18:21Z: A fastest lap for Bottas, setting a 1m50.116s to close the gap to Hamilton by 0.2s.
2020-08-30T13:17:50Z: Meanwhile Perez has struggled as he dropped behind his Racing Point team-mate Stroll at the start and has now lost places to Leclerc and Gasly on the second lap. The Mexican driver is P10 and fending off Norris.
2020-08-30T13:16:45Z: Hamilton and Bottas have darted away, but Verstappen's not completely out of the picture.
2020-08-30T13:16:17Z: Rapid start from Leclerc using those soft tyres to move up to P9 for Ferrari to jump ahead of both AlphaTauri drivers and McLaren's Norris. An even more stunning start by Magnussen up to P15 already!
2020-08-30T13:15:41Z: A fighting start from Ricciardo, getting a run on Verstappen and grabbing third into Les Combes! Verstappen then gets the Australian back, as Ocon steals fifth from Albon!
2020-08-30T13:14:25Z: And the Belgian Grand Prix is go! Who will prevail over these 44 laps?
2020-08-30T13:12:05Z: The current Spa circuit is a real drivers' circuit, quite a sight to behold. But the old track was a real Masta-piece...
2020-08-30T13:11:01Z: Outside of the top 10 there is quite a split in strategy. Kvyat in P11 on the mediums, Gasly in P12 on the hards and Leclerc in P13 on the softs. The rest of the grid behind them are on the mediums.
2020-08-30T13:10:39Z: And we're away for the formation lap!
2020-08-30T13:08:34Z: Hamilton, Bottas, Verstappen are the top 10 runners on the medium tyre.

2020-08-30T13:06:02Z: Five minute klaxon! It's almost time for the Belgian Grand Prix to get underway...
2020-08-30T12:58:47Z: Air temp is 18 degrees C, with the track at 31 degrees. It's not t-shirt and shorts weather, but it's not coat weather either.
2020-08-30T12:57:48Z: For those of you indulging in rain dances, the current risk of rain is 40%. You may wish to dance harder.
2020-08-30T12:50:05Z: Sainz will not be starting the race due to an exhaust failure. More on that as we have it.
2020-08-30T12:49:16Z: Meanwhile, Ferrari has managed to lock out the seventh row of the grid - Leclerc and Vettel start 13th and 14th.
2020-08-30T12:48:13Z: So let's recap. Hamilton smashed the track record yesterday to take pole over Bottas by half a second. Verstappen and Ricciardo occupy the second row.
2020-08-30T12:41:14Z: Good afternoon everyone! In 30 minutes it'll be that time of the weekend where we congregate on our sofas and watch the start of the Belgian Grand Prix! And we'll be with you every step of the way.
